question: What is to done of congenital cataract involving visual axis?
exp: ANSWER: (D) Immediately operate. REF: parsons 20th ed p, 257. Timing of surgery in congenital cataract: Bilateral. Unilateral. Dense. Early surgery to prevent stimulus deprivation ambylopia. Partial. Monitor lens opacities and visual function and intervene if vision deteriorates. Dense. If the u/1 cataract is dense and involves the visual axis it should be treated with urgent surgery and aggressive anti ambylopia therapy despite which results are poor, however if detected after 16 weeks surgery is not advised because ambylopia is refractory. Partial. Nonsurgical treatment with papillary dilation and c/1 occlusion to prevent ambylopia
opb: Operated when the baby reaches an appropriate age
